TITLE: Rising mortgage rates are hitting Americans' wallets. Here's how to adjust your housing budget
SUMMARY: Higher mortgage rates means a higher monthly bill for homebuyers.

TITLE: Villas by the sea: Rich Russians fleeing sanctions are pumping up Dubai's property sector
SUMMARY: Dubai is seeing its hottest real estate market in years, with sales up 45% year on year in April and 51% in May, according to the Dubai Land Department.

TITLE: The big risks in buying a house sight unseen
SUMMARY: Nearly half of homebuyers made an offer in the past two years without physically touring the property. Here are the risks involved.

TITLE: Judge holds real estate giant Cushman & Wakefield in contempt in NY probe of Trump Organization
SUMMARY: The order against Cushman & Wakefield came days after a judge lifted a contempt order against former President Donald Trump related to the investigation.

TITLE: Mortgage demand sinks even as rates drop
SUMMARY: Mortgage demand dropped last week, even as mortgage rates fell, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association.

TITLE: Australia risks recession and housing downturn after third rate hike
SUMMARY: The Reserve Bank of Australia has raised interest rates for the third time in a row on Tuesday.

TITLE: Manhattan apartment sales fall 30% in June, but prices remain high
SUMMARY: Sales contracts for Manhattan apartments plunged by nearly a third in June as the city's scorching real estate market started to cool amid recession fears.

TITLE: These 5 metros have the most million-dollar homes: If you're selling, here's what to know about the tax consequences
SUMMARY: A report finds million-dollar homes are most likely to be in metropolitan areas on the coasts. Here's what to know when selling a high-value property.

TITLE: Here's what China's real estate debt crisis could mean for Asia junk bond investors
SUMMARY: China's real estate bonds have been key to driving the performance of Asia junk bond funds, but this sector's market share has plummeted recently.

TITLE: Housing shortage starts easing as listings surge in June
SUMMARY: The historic housing shortage brought on by slow construction and strong demand from buyers in the pandemic is finally starting to ease.

TITLE: Judge lifts Trump's contempt order in New York civil probe
SUMMARY: The contempt order was imposed after Trump was found to have failed to comply with a subpoena from New York Attorney General Letitia James' office.

TITLE: Summer temperatures — and inflation — are running hot. Here's how to save money on cooling bills as prices rise
SUMMARY: The combination of a hot summer and rising energy prices can pinch Americans' budgets. Here are some ways to save money while staying cool.

TITLE: Mortgage demand stalls again, even as interest rates swing briefly lower
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates moved slightly lower last week, causing a small increase in demand for refinancing home loans.

TITLE: Home price increases slowed in April for the first time in months, S&P Case-Shiller says
SUMMARY: Prices rose 20.4% nationally in April compared with the same month a year ago, according to the S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller Index.

TITLE: Pending home sales post surprise increase in May, likely due to brief pullback in mortgage rates
SUMMARY: Pending home sales, a measure of signed contracts on existing homes, rose slightly in May, up 0.7% compared with April.

TITLE: Demand for adjustable-rate mortgages surges, as interest rates make biggest jump in 13 years
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates surged to the highest level since 2008, but more buyers applied for loans, perhaps concerned rates would move even higher.

TITLE: Sales of existing homes fell in May, and more declines are expected
SUMMARY: Sales of existing homes in May fell 3.4% to a seasonally adjusted annualized rate of 5.41 million units, according to the National Association of Realtors.

TITLE: Here's why this housing downturn is nothing like the last one
SUMMARY: The housing market has cooled off a bit after an incredibly hot stretch fueled by the pandemic. That doesn't mean it's about to be 2007 all over again.

TITLE: 'I can't win in this market': Why LGBTQ homebuyers say mortgage rates are hitting them especially hard
SUMMARY: The rapid rise in home prices, followed by a spike in mortgage rates, is particularly impactful for LGBTQ homebuyers.

TITLE: 43% of homeowners have delayed home improvements and maintenance due to inflation. Here's why that's risky
SUMMARY: If inflation is squeezing your budget, there are steps you can take as a homeowner to help avoid costly fixes.

TITLE: China's property troubles have pushed one debt indicator above levels seen in the financial crisis
SUMMARY: A measure of risk levels for Asia debt surpassed its 2009 financial crisis high, thanks to a surge in downgrades of Chinese property developers, Moody's said.

TITLE: Millennial millionaires are delaying home, car purchases due to inflation
SUMMARY: Nearly half of millennial millionaires say higher borrowing costs are causing them to delay buying a car, and 44% say higher interest rates have caused them to delay purchasing a home.

TITLE: Here's what the Federal Reserve's 0.75 percentage point rate hike — the highest in 28 years — means for you
SUMMARY: The Fed announced its highest rate hike in 28 years to fight inflation. Here's how that impacts your credit card, mortgage, car loan, student debt and savings.

TITLE: Homebuilder sentiment drops to lowest level in two years as housing demand slows
SUMMARY: Builder sentiment is getting hit by higher interest rates, which are causing a slowdown in housing demand.

TITLE: Mortgage demand is now roughly half of what it was a year ago, as interest rates move even higher
SUMMARY: Sharply rising interest rates are decimating refinance volume, and those rates, along with sky-high home prices, are hitting demand from buyers.

TITLE: 30-year mortgage rate surges to 6.28%, up from 5.5% just a week ago
SUMMARY: The average rate on the popular 30-year fixed mortgage hit 6.28% Tuesday, according to Mortgage News Daily.

TITLE: Real estate firms Compass and Redfin announce layoffs as housing market slows
SUMMARY: In filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Compass announced a 10% cut to its workforce, and Redfin announced an 8% cut.

TITLE: Federal Reserve could boost rates by 75 basis points this week: 3 money moves to make first
SUMMARY: After May's disappointing consumer price index report, some analysts are now expecting a 75 basis point hike from the Fed on Wednesday. Here's how to prepare.

TITLE: The California exodus continues as residents head south of the border
SUMMARY: Californians are increasingly making the move to Mexico to escape rising housing prices, traffic and expensive healthcare.

TITLE: Big landlords jump into the homebuilding business as demand for single-family rentals surges
SUMMARY: Big publicly traded landlords are fast becoming homebuilders, as the supply of homes for rent drops and demand surges.
